greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of permutations p of {1,...,n} such that |p(i)-p(i+1)| is in {3,4} for all i from 1 to n-1.
comment: For n>1, a(n)/2 is the number of Hamiltonian paths on the graph with vertex set {1,...,n} where i is adjacent to j iff |i-j| is in {3,4}.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
W. Edwin Clark, "permutations p in S_n such that m <= |p(i)-p(i+1)| <= M for i from 1 to n-1", SeqFan Discussion, Mar 2010.
results.author: _W. Edwin Clark_, Mar 27 2010
